## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi, I'm trying to learn more about Verus and I have some questions. What does the `-genproclimit` option do when running Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-genproclimit` option sets the number of threads for coin mining if enabled. You can set it to a specific number of threads or use `-1` to utilize all available cores. The default value is 0.

**User:**
That's helpful. What about the `-mineraddress` option? What's its purpose?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-mineraddress` option allows you to specify a single address where mined coins will be sent.

**User:**
Got it. What's the effect of setting `-minetolocalwallet` to 1 in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
When `-minetolocalwallet` is set to 1 (which is the default), mined blocks must use a coinbase address from the local wallet.

**User:**
How can I specify a custom mining distribution in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
You can use the `-miningdistribution` option to specify a custom mining distribution. This option accepts a JSON object with destination addresses or IDs and relative amounts used as ratios to divide total rewards and fees.

**User:**
What does the `-mint` option do in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-mint` option enables automatic minting and staking of coins.

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-pubkey` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-pubkey` option specifies a default address where mining and staking rewards will be sent.

**User:**
I've seen some options referred to as PBaaS options. What are they, and what do they control?

**AI Assistant:**
PBaaS options in Verus are a set of options that control the behavior of Public Blockchain as a Service (PBaaS) chains. These options include settings for accepting free imports, notarization behavior, contract upgrades, block time, chain selection, mining distribution, and notary IDs.

**User:**
That's helpful. What does the `-acceptfreeimportsfrom` option do in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-acceptfreeimportsfrom` option allows you to specify a list of PBaaS chains or networks from which to accept underpaid imports.

**User:**
What does the `-alwayssubmitnotarizations` option do in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-alwayssubmitnotarizations` option forces the submission of notarizations to the notary chain whenever merge mining or staking is eligible.

**User:**
What is the purpose of the `-approvecontractupgrade` option in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
The `-approvecontractupgrade` option allows you to vote in favor of upgrading to a specific contract when validating blocks.

N/A
What does the `-genproclimit` option do when running Verus?
The `-genproclimit` option sets the number of threads for coin mining if enabled. You can set it to a specific number of threads or use `-1` to utilize all available cores. The default value is 0.

`-genproclimit=<n>`
    Set the number of threads for coin mining if enabled (-1 = all cores,
    default: 0)`-mineraddress=<addr>`
    Send mined coins to a specific single address`-minetolocalwallet`
    Require that mined blocks use a coinbase address in the local wallet
    (default: 1)`-miningdistribution={"addressorid":<n>,...}`
    destination addresses and relative amounts used as ratios to divide
    total rewards + fees`-mint`
    Mint/stake coins automatically (default: 0)`-pubkey=<hexpubkey>`
    If set, mining and staking rewards will go to this address by default## PBaaS options:`-acceptfreeimportsfrom=<i-address>,<i-address>,...`
    "%s" no spaces - accept underpaid imports from these PBaaS chains or
    networks - default is empty`-allowdelayednotarizations`
    Do not notarize in order to prevent slower notarizations (default = 0, notarize to prevent slowing down)`-alwayssubmitnotarizations`
    Submit notarizations to notary chain whenever merge mining/staking and eligible (default = 0, only as needed)`-approvecontractupgrade=<0xf09...>`
    When validating blocks, vote to agree to upgrade to the specific
    contract. Default is no upgrade.`-blocktime=<n>`
    Set target block time (in seconds) for difficulty adjustment (default: 60)`-chain=pbaaschainname`
    loads either mainnet or resolves and loads a PBaaS chain if not vrsc or vrsctest`-miningdistributionpassthrough`
   uses the same miningdistribution values and addresses/IDs as Verus when merge mining`-notarizationperiod=<n>`
   Set minimum spacing consensus between cross-chain notarization, in blocks (default: 10, min 10 min)`-notaryid=<ID@>`
   VerusID used for PBaaS and Ethereum cross-chain notarization
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-01_verusd_options.md

What are PBaaS options in Verus, and what do they control?

PBaaS options in Verus are a set of options that control the behavior of Public Blockchain as a Service (PBaaS) chains. These options include settings for accepting free imports, notarization behavior, contract upgrades, block time, chain selection, mining distribution, and notary IDs.

`-genproclimit=<n>`
    Set the number of threads for coin mining if enabled (-1 = all cores,
    default: 0)`-mineraddress=<addr>`
    Send mined coins to a specific single address`-minetolocalwallet`
    Require that mined blocks use a coinbase address in the local wallet
    (default: 1)`-miningdistribution={"addressorid":<n>,...}`
    destination addresses and relative amounts used as ratios to divide
    total rewards + fees`-mint`
    Mint/stake coins automatically (default: 0)`-pubkey=<hexpubkey>`
    If set, mining and staking rewards will go to this address by default## PBaaS options:`-acceptfreeimportsfrom=<i-address>,<i-address>,...`
    "%s" no spaces - accept underpaid imports from these PBaaS chains or
    networks - default is empty`-allowdelayednotarizations`
    Do not notarize in order to prevent slower notarizations (default = 0, notarize to prevent slowing down)`-alwayssubmitnotarizations`
    Submit notarizations to notary chain whenever merge mining/staking and eligible (default = 0, only as needed)`-approvecontractupgrade=<0xf09...>`
    When validating blocks, vote to agree to upgrade to the specific
    contract. Default is no upgrade.`-blocktime=<n>`
    Set target block time (in seconds) for difficulty adjustment (default: 60)`-chain=pbaaschainname`
    loads either mainnet or resolves and loads a PBaaS chain if not vrsc or vrsctest`-miningdistributionpassthrough`
   uses the same miningdistribution values and addresses/IDs as Verus when merge mining`-notarizationperiod=<n>`
   Set minimum spacing consensus between cross-chain notarization, in blocks (default: 10, min 10 min)`-notaryid=<ID@>`
   VerusID used for PBaaS and Ethereum cross-chain notarization
./raw_text_input_wiki/clifaq-01_verusd_options.md
What does the `-acceptfreeimportsfrom` option do in Verus?
